exceptions.exn: The LHS of sup_appE (sup _ _) does not match any subterm of the goal

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
B: A -> lattice
s: Pred (dfunLattice B)
x: A

Goal:
sup s x = sup [Pred y | exists f : dfunLattice B, f \In s /\ y = f x]

Premises:
dfunLattice : forall A : Type, (A -> lattice) -> lattice
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> seq A -> Prop
Notation sup := @Lattice.sup
sup_appE : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (x : A), sup s x = sup [Pred y | exists f : A -> B, f \In s /\ y = f x]
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> lattice s : Pred (dfunLattice B) x : A |- Type] ?T' : [A : Type B : A -> lattice s : Pred (dfunLattice B) x : A |- Type] ?f : [A : Type B : A -> lattice s : Pred (dfunLattice B) x : A |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [A : Type B : A -> lattice s : Pred (dfunLattice B) x : A |- ?T'] ?s : [A : Type B : A -> lattice s : Pred (dfunLattice B) x : A |- seq ?T]
supM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> sup s <== x
Fix_F_inv : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop), well_founded R -> forall (P : A -> Type) (F : forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x), (forall (x : A) (f g : forall y : A, R y x -> P y), (forall (y : A) (p : R y x), f y p = g y p) -> F x f = F x g) -> forall (x : A) (r s : Acc R x), Fix_F P F r = Fix_F P F s
Mem_map : forall (T T' : Type) (f : T -> T') (x : T) (s : seq T), x \In s -> f x \In [seq f i | i <- s]
supP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== sup s
Image_mem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (P : Pred A) (x : A), x \In P -> f x \In [Image f i | i <- P]
sup_closed = fun T : lattice => [Pred s | forall d : Pred_Class, d <=p s -> sup d \In s] : forall T : lattice, Simpl_Pred (Pred T) Arguments sup_closed {T}
canLR : forall (rT aT : Type) (f : aT -> rT) (g : rT -> aT) (x : rT) (y : aT), cancel f g -> x = f y -> g x = y
Image_inj_eqmem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] =p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 =p X2
Image_inj_sub : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] <=p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 <=p X2
Im_mem : forall (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (a : A), b = f a -> a \In P -> image_spec P f b
tarski_gfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_gfp f) = tarski_gfp f
tarski_lfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_lfp f) = tarski_lfp f
ImageU : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), [Image f i | i <- PredU X1 X2] =p [PredU [Image f i | i <- X1] & [Image f i | i <- X2]]
image_spec_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (P0 : Prop), (forall a : A, b = f a -> a \In P -> P0) -> image_spec P f b -> P0
image_spec_sind : forall (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) (P0 : SProp), (forall a : A, b = f a -> a \In P -> P0) -> image_spec P f b -> P0
fun_supM : forall (A : Type) (B : lattice) (s : Pred (A -> B)) (p : A -> B), (forall q : A -> B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> fun_sup s <== p
tarski_lfp_least : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T) (x : T), f x = x -> tarski_lfp f <== x
tarski_gfp_greatest : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T) (x : T), f x = x -> x <== tarski_gfp f
In_cons : forall (T : Type) (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), x \In y :: s < -> x = y \/ x \In s
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
pair_supM : forall (A B : lattice) (s : Pred (A * B)) (p : A * B), (forall q : A * B, q \In s -> q <== p) -> pair_sup s <== p
infM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred_Class) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> x <== y) -> x <== inf s
Record mixin_of (T : poset) : Type := Mixin { mx_sup : Pred T -> T; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s; _ : forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x } Arguments Lattice.Mixin [T] [mx_sup]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope
supE : forall (T : lattice) (s1 s2 : Pred T), s1 =p s2 -> sup s1 = sup s2
In_split : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq_PredType T), x \In s -> exists s1 s2 : seq T, s = s1 ++ x :: s2
sub_asym : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}) (y : {x0 : T | x0 \In s}), sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y x -> x = y
Inductive image_spec (A B : Type) (P : Pred A) (f : A -> B) (b : B) : Prop := Im_mem : forall a : A, b = f a -> a \In P -> image_spec P f b Arguments image_spec [A B]%type_scope _ _%function_scope Arguments Im_mem [A B]%type_scope [P] [f]%function_scope [b a]
Preim = fun (T rT : Type) (f : T -> rT) (d : Pred rT) => [Pred x | xPreim f d x] : forall T rT : Type, (T -> rT) -> Pred rT -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments Preim {T rT}%type_scope _%function_scope
